bsem 1.0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

sem: The SEM Function

Source: R/sem.R
sem.Rd

Structural Equation Models (SEM) and particular cases via rstan interface

sem(
  data,
  paths,
  blocks,
  signals,
  row_names = rownames(data),
  prior_specs = list(coef = c("normal(0,1)"), error_var = c("inv_gamma(2.1, 1.1)")),
  cores = parallel::detectCores(),
  pars = c("alpha", "lambda", "sigma2", "Xna"),
  iter = 2000,
  chains = 4,
  scaled = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

a mandatory data.frame object where the columns are variables and the rows are observations
paths

list referring to the inner model
blocks

list of column names (or integers in 1:ncol(data)) indicating the manisfest variables correpoding to each block;
signals

list referring to the signals of the factor loadings initial values; must be true: (length(signals) == length(blocks)) && (lengths(signals) == lengths(blocks))
prior_specs

prior settings for the Bayesian approach; only `normal(0,...)` for coef and `inv_gamma` for error_var are temporarily available, beta is ignored if paths are not specific; next versions should include more options
cores

number of core threads to be used
pars

which parameters to be included in the outcome; options are any subset of default c("alpha", "lambda", "sigma2", "Xna")
iter

number of iterations
chains

number of posterior chains
scaled

logical; indicates whether to center and scale the data
...

further arguments passed to or from other methods
rownames

refers to the observation vector of characters; must have nrow(data) lenght; defaults to rownames(data)

Value

An object of class sem; a list of 14 to 16:

stanfit

S4 object of class stanfit

posterior

the list of posterior draws separate by chains

model

character; pointer to pre-defined stan model

mean_loadings

matrix of factor loadings posterior means

mean_scores

matrix of factor scores posterior means

mean_var

vector of error variances posterior means

coef

vector of regression coefficients posterior means

stats

posterior descriptives statistics

blocks

list of blocks

paths

list of paths

credint

Highest posterior density intervals (HPD)

h

vector of communalities

PVTE

vector of total variance proportions

AFR2

adjusted coefficient of determination

SQE

explained sums of squares

SQT

total sums of squares

Details

Fits the SEM to specific data

Examples

data('set1')

fit1 <- sem(data = set1$set, blocks = set1$blocks,
 chains = 1)
#> 
#> SAMPLING FOR MODEL 'factorial' NOW (CHAIN 1).
#> Chain 1:

#> Chain 1: 1000 transitions using 10 leapfrog steps per transition would take 8.31 seconds.

if (FALSE) {
data('set2')

fit2 <- sem(data = set2$set, blocks = set2$blocks,
 chains = 4, iter = 2500, warmup = 1000)
summary(fit2)
}
